body:
The docs do contain a link to str.split under the "See Also":
http://pandas-docs.github.io/pandas-docs-travis/reference/api/pandas.Series.str.split.html?highlight=str.split#pandas.Series.str.split

Does that suffice?

On Tue, Mar 5, 2019 at 8:23 AM Ruari McCloskey <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> In the docs we see:
> [image: screen shot 2019-03-05 at 14 17 32]
> <https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16627482/53811498-73403780-3f51-11e9-9591-8489096218b1.png>
> but in fact the default behaviour of str.split() is more complicated than
> using str.split(" ") as detailed in the python 3 documentation
> <https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str.split>. Perhaps
> linking to this explanation of the splitting algorithm would be preferable
> or writing something slightly more verbose would be preferable?
>
